name: Holiday Inn London-Gatwick Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before our flight to Marrakech and we honestly can't fault it - brilliant fast easy check in,, secure car park that had plenty of spaces, brilliant sized room that was clean and comfortable and great sleep quality.
reviews.title: Fab stop over before flight

reviews.text: We normally eat at the airport however the lady on reception said that breakfast was only £10.95 if ordered in advance so we decided to go for that, it was absolutely brilliant, a massive selection from cooked breakfast, cereal, big range of fruit pasteries and toast as well as continental meat and cheese all freshly cooked and tasted amazing.
reviews.title: Great value, dated decor in bedrooms, beds gave us backache

reviews.text: 5 mins from north terminal and even closer to the south, brilliant cheap hopper bus that was on time with no problems.
reviews.title: Clean and fresh room
Good stay - but charges for wi- fi still exorbitant
reviews.text: Overall we had a great stay and would definitely recommend it
Very close to airport
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Spent one night at the hotel on a business trip. Check in was efficient. The facility is straight forward, nothing extravagant. Room was ok, I was lucky and got a smoking room, the windows can be opened for fresh air. In the room and bathroom everthing worked, clean, amenities there was nothing too much and nothing missing, just right. A coffee maker, but no mini bar and no ironing board (except a trouser press). Large flat screen TV. No snacks served at bar (except via room service). Breakfast was nice. Personnel friendly.
reviews.title: Typical Airport Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for the second time ( should have learnt first time) it was a pre flight stopover and i suppose that it is a good way of parking your car for a week and from that point of view it works. but once you are in the Hotel you need a second mortgage to buy a drink, almost double the local pub, and the biggest insult of all is Wi Fi at £5 an hour !!! can you believe it, its free almost everywhere you go. the other thing is that it costs 10p a minute to call thm and you hang on the 10 mins to be told to call back they are busy, i wont use them again for these reasons.
reviews.title: Dont get ripped off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our flight to Verona. Room was clean and comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. Parking was easy and hassle free. We also had an evening meal which was very good and the staff were friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Stay & Park

reviews.text: This hotel will charge you for the most trivial items and if the airline changes your schedule they will not refund a penny. It's their right of course, but it shows how greedy this management is. They offer a low price but then make it back in small ways. The rooms are musty as well. Almost any other property would be preferred.
reviews.title: Greedy

reviews.text: I booked this hotel on line with Holiday Extra specifically as it stated the car park was at the hotel. When we arrived the reception staff asked us to sign a disclaimer and leave them our car keys as they would move the car to another car park when we were gone. We were disappointed that this was not made clear on their web site as we would not have chosen to park here but by then it was too late as we'd already paid. The hotel itself was adequate and the transfer to the airport smooth.
reviews.title: Do Not Leave Your Car at this Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night prior to our holiday. On arrival at 9.30pm the staff were polite & friendly with a quick check in. We were given ground floor adjacent rooms which were both furnished with drinks & shower facilities. We had a choice of pillows, hard/soft. Rooms were quiet. We used wake up alarm on tv.
reviews.title: 8 day park & Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a snack & drinks in the bar, which were reasonably priced for hotels in London.
reviews.title: Good and getting better
Pre Flight Overnight Stay
reviews.text: We had to be at the airport for 5pm so didn't have breakfast here.

The hotel arranged a taxi to the airport for us the next morning which was prompt and waiting for us when we checked out. Taxi to North terminal was £6.00, worth while for 3 of us. Taxi firm gave us a card to contact them on return, which we did with a prompt pick up.
reviews.title: Easy and stress free.

reviews.text: On return to hotel our car was waiting in condition we left it and staff were prompt & polite.
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening meal was terrible - tastless and very expensive. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Comfy room, nice breakfast, terrible evening meal

reviews.text: Breakfast, however, is lovely and there is a very wide selection of foods.
reviews.title: Convenient,comfortable and really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was large and comfy, a little too warm however as we couldn't open the window and the air con was broken.
reviews.title: Worst night's sleep ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wouldn't eat an evening meal here again. But would maybe use on a B&B basis only.
reviews.title: A Gatwick stopover to avoid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a great time in this hotel. The room was spacious and as well as the bathroom. The service was great so thumbs up to the staff.
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Initially no problems, however it could have appeared more clean and the airport shuffle busses could have been on time.
reviews.title: An O.K stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night stay with 8 days parking very good value. Room was comfortable although it was a little on the cool side. Meal for 2 with wine is about £50 we ate in the bar area as the restaurant seemed busy.
reviews.title: A very good service

reviews.text: Can't comment on breakfast as we had an early flight. The bus transfers were £3 per person each way so less than a cab.
reviews.title: basic airport hotel

reviews.text: On arriving back at the hotel to collect our car it was parked up outside close to the main entrance.
reviews.title: Convenient, efficient airport hotel.

reviews.text: Overall a good experience would use this again and recommend it.
reviews.title: probably the worst Holiday Inn I've ever seen

reviews.text: Offloaded at LGW on a Saturday afternoon late July. Sat down and had a coffee and did a search for a room on the internet. Holiday Inn was available. Got in the bus and went there. Went to reception and asked if we could check in on the "priority rate quoted on the internet". Told we could not have that rate, as the person we talked to did not have the authority to give it. Then asked if I could sit down, unpack my laptop, and book over the "net" ,would he accept it. Answer yes. 20 minutes later he did. IHG, I have cut up your "loyalty card"and hereby forfeit my 20000+ so called points. Thanks for absolutely nothing, which is exactly what you will knowingly get from us for the rest of our lives.
reviews.title: priority club farce

reviews.text: Usual Holiday Inn dated decor. Restaurant was over-priced, food mediocre ,staff had no knowledge of menu items. 18 pounds a day extra for internet. similar for breakfast. Glad to find the Tesco just down the road so eating was more affordable for the 2 days stay. Not much else in the area. Room was clean, Front desk service was good. Other reviews say good value for money. I guess 600 pounds for two nights and one meal in a 3 star is good. Seemed ridiculous to me. Same type of hotel in Canada would be about 70 a night with free breakfast. UK is expensive to visit and live from what I gathered talking to the locals. Petrol station next door had a good deal on Cider the first night and is 24 hrs. so at least cheap drinks could be had.
reviews.title: At least it was a few minutes cab ride from airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Summary: did what it had to. Roof over head while convenient to airport. Basic.
reviews.title: Not impressed

reviews.text: We stayed here for a night before an early morning flight. The restaurant was pricey, wine was over priced. Our room card never admitted us, so on three occasions I had to go back to reception from a room on the 5th floor and down a long corridor. I was told it was because of a mobile phone demagnetising the card, but having stayed in many hotels, around the world with the same system, and never a problem, I think this needs to be sorted out. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was quiet considering the large number of occupants.
reviews.title: Good - and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle bus was £3 per person, each way. Ran every 15 minutes. Having parked in many off
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel

reviews.text: This is a typical Holiday Inn. Some things I like about it and some things I don't. I had a twin room and the beds were incredibly narrow! The hotel is on its own with NOTHING around. I would go back if the price is right.
reviews.title: It is fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our flight back to the USA. My only objection is that they charge for a 5 minute bus ride to and from the airport. It is three pounds, and the bus driver tried to rip me off since I offered Euros or Dollars. The hotel to its credit did pay for the return to the airport.
reviews.title: Where to stay the night before

reviews.text: We received in our room, orange juice, water, and a candy bar for free. I ate lunch in the Pub and dinner in the Traders restaurant in the hotel. The local prices were similar to US Dollars but in pounds, so it was about a 50% premium to what I was used to. Having said that I found the food served at the hotel was much better than that at the usual Holiday Inn;
reviews.title: Good Experience, better than expected

reviews.text: The rooms were fairly roomy and I was quite happy with the arrangements.
reviews.title: Absolutely average

reviews.text: They had vending machines for essentials. Another gripe was there was no ice machine available. You had to go to the pub for ice.
reviews.title: Good for the right price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night in June in an unmodernised room. It was an Hotwire booking, so I assume you don't get allocated the best rooms. However, it was clean; bed was fine and beakfast was "full English" of a pretty good freshly cooked quality, plus apart from a very small amount of noise from other guests in the corridor, which was to be expected, it was exceptionally quiet. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable - Clean - No airport noise

reviews.text: My family and I (wife, 7 y.o and 11 y.o. boys) spend the night before our flight at this hotel. It was easy to find, on the shuttle line for the terminals and rental car drop off - so the convenience was great.
reviews.title: Great for what it is - an airport hotel...

reviews.text: It's a Holiday Inn, not a Four Seasons, so don;t expect white glove treatment and you won't be disappointed. The room was very clean and comfortable, even at four of us. The price was great.
reviews.title: Made wrong choice on selecting this hotel

reviews.text: The restaurant was a nice surprise, if not a bit out of place with more than just your basic choices. It had some very interesting plates and the staff did their best to make you feel you were in an upscale establishment.
reviews.title: dont bother!! much better hotels than this!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would've liked free Wifi rather than having to purchase 1 hr. or 24 hr. plans. Otherwise, no complaints at all - I would stay there again before a morning flight in Gatwick.
reviews.title: Convenient Hotel with Great Restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a Holiday Inn. At Gatwick.
reviews.title: No Surprises

reviews.text: And it was exactly how I expected a Holiday Inn in Gatwick would be like. Nothing especially good about it; nothing especially bad.
reviews.title: comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a decent four-star hotel close to the airport - some place to stay before catching an early flight.
reviews.title: Find a Better Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very apprehensive after reading previous reviews about staying here, but I should not have worried. We used this hotel prior to our flight to Orlando and took advantage of the onsite car parking. Check in was quick and efficient, room was comfortable and clean, spacious enough for 2 adults and two teenagers. We had our evening meal in the Lounge bar and we all found our choices delicious. We did not have breakfast as we had to be at the airport early. We took a taxi (£3 each for the hotel shuttle) cost £9, which we prebooked the night before, and on our return the taxi back was £11. Our car was ready parked by the hotel entrance on our return. I would not hesitate to stay there again
reviews.title: Once is enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked directly with the hotel the park and stay package for £150 and stayed here the night before flying out to USA. Checked in at 3pm after doing twilight check-in at the airport. The Reception staff immediately put me off the hotel, they were abrupt (myself and my hubby were the only guests at the desk), rude (when we said we didn't have a credit card to register to the room) and the executive room that we had booked was very disappointing.
reviews.title: "free" courtesy bus costs £3 each way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: booked this hotel for our stay before our holiday & place to park up the car. The place was no problem to find & ample car parking space was available. Upon entering the hotel I was greeted by a nice lady at reception, who went through all the paper work smoothly & also sorted out bus tickets for our journey to & from the airport by bus. The room was adequate, clean & we spent that evening down in the restaurant which was very relaxed with good beer & food.
reviews.title: A nice place to stay before holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our return from the holiday we picked up the car with no hassle.
reviews.title: Perfect stay before and after holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Should I fly from Gatwick in the future, I will use this hotel again
reviews.title: Ideal overnight stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel plus on site parking before and after flying from Gatwick. It was the perfect choice. Good price, excellent requested room on top floor with everything we needed including a big comfy bed and large sofa. It was immaculately clean. We had one breakfast which had fresh fruit, good juice, fresh bread, a toaster that worked and good quality bacon. Also you could make your own pancakes with maple syrup - excellent. The waitresses in the dining room were attentive. Without exception the staff we met were extremely friendly and greeted us with a cheerful word and a smile. The parking system was very good too. The check in and out was efficient and stress free. How they manage to achieve such high standards in a hotel with such a large daily turn over is quite amazing.
reviews.title: Great for Parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel for an airport stay. I have stayed here 3 times now. The rooms are comfortable with everything you need. The hotel provides a 24 hour shuttle to the airport which is really convenient for early/late departures. The shuttle is £3 pp each way. I usually book room only (as I seem to only book the first flights out of Gatwick!) so I cannot comment on the breakfast. They have a bar in the hotel with a food menu which I have sampled and enjoyed. We will continue booking this hotel for further Gatwick flights.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here prior to flying abroad.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: Used the park and stay facility for 15 nights.
reviews.title: Excellent holiday transit hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was comfortable and had all the neccessary facilities including a bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Excellent for parking/stay

reviews.text: Staff were helpful and efficient.
reviews.title: Good airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no complaints and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Poor quality and in dire need of modernising

likes.disliked: — Shabby, tired rooms with poor bathroom and broken bed

reviews.text: We stayed for one night before flying on to Orlando. The only bad part of the hotel was check-in. We booked through BA and they had messed up the names which was not the hotels fault, but the fact that they put a poor trainee on a busy front desk with no help (he actually asked for help and was told very abruptly to look on the computer!) did not help. Check in took half an hour, which seems like ages at 11.30pm when you are with an 8 year old!
reviews.title: Poor check in service

reviews.text: The family room we booked was fine, clean and an ok size for one night.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast the next day was good and the transfers to/from the airport were also handy. I would stay here again as it would probably only be for one night.
reviews.title: Good way to start a holiday

reviews.text: I was stuck in London one night and needed to stay close to the airport to get out early the next day. On recommendation of my mother I booked the Holiday Inn at the airport, and it was a great choice. First of all, there is a shuttle that runs every 15 minutes from the hotel to the airport for 3 pounds, which is much less than a cab, and very convenient. Also, there is a bar/restaurant in the lobby of the hotel with reasonably priced food which is good. The room was typical of a Holiday Inn room, however, was clean and the bed comfy. I got a rate of 79 pounds online, which is very reasonable by London standards. London is one of my favorite places to visit and if I were coming for vacation, I would definitely pick somewhere closer to town, however, for an airport hotel, this one is really good. Also, it is pretty convenient to get to downtown London b/c all you have to do is go to the airport and take the Gatwick Express straight to Victoria Station.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with holiday parking

likes.liked: — convenience for Gatwick Airport with good pub nearby

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before an early morning flight from Gatwick Airport which is just a short ride from the hotel. We went by taxi to the airport which actually worked out cheaper than getting the shuttle which we did on the return journey. Part of the package was parking for our car while we were away.
reviews.title: Quiet, nicely updated, close to airport

reviews.text: This is not your average airport hotel! A five minute walk from a historic 14th century pub in Crawley, the HI Gatwick was comfortable, although not luxurious and a terrific deal for families (kids under 14 eat free from a special but generous menu). After 3 weeks in Europe with 6 lodging changes our family of 5 needed a [affordable] place to rest and relax before our flight home.
reviews.title: Holiday Inn Gatwick is a Family Hotel

reviews.text: Upon arrival, there were several business people in the lounge area. However, by 5pm, reception area was hopping with kids and families. No pool (small fee to use the one at a nearby hotel) but no worries once the kids found our there was a Pillow Menu.
reviews.title: Good Quality Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Enjoyed mainly by locals, it is a perfect place for families to leave their car and enjoy a decent night's rest before flying. Our rooms were interconnected - one with 2 twins and a rollaway and the other with a king. They did offer single rooms that could accommodate 5 and they are reconfiguring rooms that will host 6-7, in an effort to attract even MORE families.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed in some dreadful airport hotels, I wasn't quite sure what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was clean, modern and bright. Reception was busy but we didn't need to wait too long. The restaurant served good quality food and the service was good. The bedrooms were clean and comfortable. Parking services were very efficient, probably one of the easiest airport parking experiences I've ever had. We will definitely use this hotel next time we have an early or late flight.
reviews.title: don't waste your money

likes.disliked: — Poor quality, incredible attitude of guy at the desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Gatwick en route to Venezuela.. I Have stayed at several Holiday Inns around the world. (Sarajevo being the best one)..
reviews.title: Good airport parking package

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel but it is definately THE LAST.
reviews.title: GRIM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking package is a good deal but the room was horrible and depressing - not the ideal way to start your holiday.
reviews.title: Great hotel and parking package

reviews.text: The room was smelly, small and delapidated. NEVER AGAIN. Trravel inns are superior to this by miles!
reviews.title: It beats sleeping on the street - barely!

reviews.text: The only good point was the breakfast - pricey but very nice.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before catching a very early morning flight. The overnight stay and 8 days parking worked out cheaper than staying in a budget hotel and buying parking separately. Our room was very modern and spacious, pretty much the same as any other Holiday Inn really. Usual facilities in the room - hairdryer, coffee making facilities etc...The hotel is far enough from the airport itself that we couldn't hear any aircraft at all although we were on the far side of the building. The hotel has a bar and restaurant as well. We hadn't planned to eat there and when I saw the prices, I was glad - really expensive but as expected for an airport hotel I guess! We didn't take breakfast either as we were leaving at 4am so can't comment on that. There is a Tesco Extra within a 5 minute walk of the hotel which was pretty handy. The parking system was very straightforward, just a form to fill in at check in and upon our return the car was waiting by the exit for us - the whole process was very quick and easy. Staff were very helpful and friendly - we asked for more coffee for our room and someone was sent up to deliver it to the room within a couple of minutes. The only gripe I have with Gatwick hotels generally is the cost of the shuttle bus to and from the airport - £3 per person each way for a couple of minutes in the bus - really irritating and yet impossible to walk from most hotels due to the lack of pavements! Overall though a good package and definitely worth comparing the price of the park and fly deal compared to buying separately.
reviews.title: good offers for stay & fly

reviews.text: Stayed overnight as part of stay & park deal before a week away. Bit further away from airport than I thought, as was hoping to walk to terminal, but this was my fault for not checking and bus trip was fine. Very welcoming staff, and booking in process good. Parking straight forward. Breakfast really good. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Easy to find and reasonable value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a night before a very early flight and left the car for a week. The price was excellent using their own website and the service was very good. Check in was quick, the room had everything we needed. The bar was good but the food was quite expensive. Thinking of the value for the parking and hotel stay this evened itself out. The early morning transfer was quick but on the way back we landed in the middle of the night and the 30 minute wait was a cold end to the holiday! If I was arriving in the middle of the night again I would not buy the transfer on the way back and simply grab a cab. I will choose this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great deal for a night before a flight with parking

reviews.text: Firstly, I have to see that I have not stayed at this hotel.
reviews.title: Front Desk Staff - Above and Beyond

reviews.text: My husband booked a room at this hotel for our niece and 2 companions, for a one night's stay, following their flight from Montreal. He requested a 12 noon check-in which the hotel kindly agreed to.
reviews.title: Good place to stay if the price is right.

reviews.text: The naughty niece did not arrive until 9pm (out enjoying London with phone switched off) and we were frantic; making regular calls to the hotel reception staff, worrying what might have happened. The reception staff were very kind and patient and, when the group finally checked in, the male receptionist used his own mobile phone to call my husband in order to put our minds at rest.
reviews.title: Very convenient for the airport

reviews.text: We stayed during October the night before an early flight. We had arranged a 'parking package' and with the rooms included, the cost was around the same as regular long-term parking.
reviews.title: Park, Sleep & Fly stay

reviews.text: The staff at check-in were very helpful and took care of the car arrangements. We wanted to split the cost of the parking and rooms and this was no trouble for them to arrange. We left our cars in the car park just outside of the building and they were waiting for us on our return, they had been taken off-site for the duration of our stay.
reviews.title: Close to Gatwick, good for business
No sleep, terrible service
reviews.text: The hotel was adequate and comfortable, rooms were clean but in need of updating; it was obvious this hotel is very well used. The room had all the usual amenities - ie hairdryer, kettle and tea/coffee and shampoo/shower gel etc. We didn't hear any noise from the neighbours and overall had a good night's sleep, even though we had to get up at around 4am.

We ate at the restaurant in the evening and the food was very nice and service good. We used the shuttle bus to get to the North terminal and these run very regularly, even in the early hours - every 10 mins or so. Purchase your bus tickets at Reception in advance £3.00 each way, half price for children. The bus drops you at the terminal, but it is a bit of a hike to the entrance.
reviews.title: On the whole......start of holiday. Looking forward to dinner

reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel for the parking package and the friendliness of the staff we met. Overall, it met our requirements and made the start of our holiday a lot easier.
reviews.title: Good hotel

description: The Holiday Inn Gatwick Airport combines an excellent range of facilities and services for both the business and leisure travellers, including High Speed Internet Access, Conference and Banqueting facilities (for up to 120 delegates). Why not book Park, Stay and Go next time you fly from Gatwick. Click here.The Holiday Inn Gatwick Airport offers Exclusive Airport Parking / Long term parking packages with accommodation known as Park, Stay and Go packages. The Holiday Inn Gatwick Airport is ideally located at Jct 9a of the M23 and with easy links to the M25, A23 and A217, as well as being only half a mile from Gatwick Airport (with a shuttle bus running 24 hours everyday) and close to Manor Royal Industrial Estate. London is easily accessible from the Holiday Inn Gatwick Airport via the Gatwick Express to London Victoria leaving every 30 minutes. The Holiday Inn Gatwick Airport is an ideal choice if you are looking to stay in an Airport Hotel or looking for a hotel in one of the surrounding areas, for example, in Brighton, Surrey or even a London.Kids Eat & Stay Free**Terms and Conditions apply
